headline: Super-Delicious Zuppa Toscana
description: Zuppa Toscana made with sausage, potatoes, cream, spinach, and red pepper flakes. Tastes just like the one at your local Italian chain restaurant.

video.description: A rich soup made with sausage, potatoes, and cream.
video.name: Super Delicious Zuppa Toscana

name: Super-Delicious Zuppa Toscana
recipeIngredient: 4 slices bacon, cut into 1/2 inch pieces
0.25 bunch fresh spinach, tough stems removed

recipeInstructions.text: Cook Italian sausage and red pepper flakes in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat until crumbly, browned, and no longer pink, 10 to 15 minutes. Drain and set aside.

Cook bacon in the same Dutch oven over medium heat until crisp, about 10 minutes. Drain, leaving a few tablespoons of drippings with the bacon in the bottom of the Dutch oven. Stir in onions and garlic; cook until onions are soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.

Stir in chicken broth and bring to a boil over high heat. Add potatoes and simmer until fork tender, about 20 minutes. Reduce heat to medium; stir in cream, cooked sausage, and spinach. Cook and stir until spinach has wilted and sausage is warmed through; serve.

review.reviewBody: Great Recipe that is way better than any Zupa you can get out to eat. I do use Kale I like the texture and flavor much better however that is preference. I may use a bit more garlic and a bit of cayenne if I am feeling spicy. Please be aware that if it is too salty I would look at the PRE-made or mixed ingredients you are choosing to use, chicken broth is often the culprit and secondly the type of sausage you are using. Most of the main brands of broth are loaded with salt Organic or homemade is really the best way to leave out the salt. I often will use bacon bits that we can use as a topper instead of it getting cooking in the soup but I like the flavor of it. I also like to put a bit of fresh parm on top.
My favorite soup! This is a great recipe and delicious. I followed the recipe. Only add shredded Parmesan to each bowl.
Our Favorite recipe for Zuppa Toscana ever! You won‚Äôt find one better.
I used kale instead of spinach. This soup is A++
Best soup I have ever made!!! I did substitute the Spinach for Kale just because I had Kale. Very yummy!
tasted horrible and found something in my soup
Just off somehow. I can't put my finger on it.
Excellent soup- I make a couple minor adjustments. I use ground turkey instead of sausage. I season the meat with salt, pepper, onion and garlic powder.I also use milk if I don‚Äôt have cream.
So great. Reminded me of Olive Garden's soup. I added a couple more strips of bacon and used red potatoes. This is going in my "favororite recipes" collection!
This soup is delicious. I followed the recipe and it turned out grate. The second time I made it I cut my potatoes into chunks. Delicious,
The recipe is very easy to follow. I did not have the chicken broth but I did have chicken bullion I also did not have spinach I used kale.
I made it close enough to the recipe and it was great!

I make this very often, maybe once a every week. I'm not sure where some people have gone wrong, but mind isn't salty and it comes out just right. My husband absolutely loves it and it tastes just like the one from Olive Garden if not better. Thank you for posting this.

COld rainy day screamed SOUP - Made the Zuppa Toscana and it IS 'Super-Delicious' - Followed recipe except shorted the sausage - Thinking I would cut recipe in 1/2 - NOT a chance! Ended up making entire recipe and SO glad I did - It really is DELICIOUS!! (DID thicken it a bit with cornstartch/water) LOVE it!!
We make our own Italian sausage so i used that, used kale instead of spinach, used a whole 12 oz. of bacon. ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!!!!!!!

Was very different when i made it myself versus a friends, but in both dishes i think the broth was lacking heavily in flavor. Kind of bland. I still very much love this though so homey and delicious. Cheap to make but this really only makes 4-5 servings and thats after i added like a whole extra cup of chicken broth.
Delicious. Was a hit with the family.
Best... soup... EVER!!!!!

Absolutely delicious! When using low sodium chicken broth you'll have to salt to taste. I also deglazed the pan before onions and garlic with white wine. I used an entire bag of sliced kale from trader Joe's instead of spinach and seasoned with some smoked paprika and served with parmesan. My family loves it!
My husband and I love it! I made it twice already. We top ours off with Italian bread crumbs and Parmigiano cheese! Thanks for sharing!
This was an easy and wonderful soup! My family loved it and I will definitely make it again.

I made this delicious soup. I followed the recipe . The Italian sausage I used had fennel and was delicious. I think next time I will use 1/2 lb. Of mild and 1/2 lb. Of hot sausage, I like it spicy. My family loved it and said it was the ‚Äúbest I ever made ‚Äú.
Instead of spinach I use kale. It was was really good and my family loved it! I'll definitely put the recipe in my book to make again.
1-6-23 Yummy yum yum

My family loves, loves, loves this recipe! I use hot Italian sausage since we like things spicy and still add the red pepper flakes while cooking as well. We also love bacon, so I add about half a pack instead of just the four slices. I have made it both by leaving the recommended 'few' tablespoons of bacon grease and also by leaving all of the grease. I highly recommend leaving only the few tablespoons. The texture was off when I left it all. I also use chopped up Kale at the end because we like the stiffer texture better. This is such an easy and flavorful recipe!
We only made a half recipe, but still used the full pound of sausage. It was great. Super flavorful.
Delicious! Family loved it. I tweaked it some. Cut back slightly on the red pepper, added slightly more spinach, and added 1/4 cup of finely sliced white mushrooms with the garlic and onion.
Made some adjustments for personal taste.
My favorite soup in the whole wide world. Super easy to make and absolutely delicious.

Excellent recipe! Quick and delicious! Omitted the pepper flakes per personal preference and used kale instead of spinach. Used a small amount of arrowroot powder to slightly thicken soup. This recipe saves me a trip to Olive Garden to order half-gallon take-out of zuppa Toscana üôÇ

Made it exactly as presented and even my soup hating husband couldn‚Äôt stop eating it. He had 3 bowls and kept commenting about how good it was. He even woke up the next morning talking about last nights soup! Too bad there were no left overs!!
Wow!! This dish deserves 6 stars. Easy to make and super delicious. I used yellow potatoes. And for once, it looks just like the picture.
I love this soup. I substitute kale for spinach and cauliflower for potatoes. We always have Italian food for Christmas eve, so this is going to be our soup this year.
I love this soup. I make it with cubed potatoes instead of sliced, but otherwise just as printed. Everyone I make it for loves it. It is going to be my Christmas day soup for the family.

I read the comments about the level of saltiness in this soup. Always thoroughly read your recipe twice before making. Here, you have 3 ingredients over which you have no control on the level of salt: chicken broth, bacon, Italian sausage. So not adding any salt of your own and keeping the integrity of the soup, use sodium-free chicken stock OR make and freeze your own chicken stock (to which you never add salt!). I have purchased some Italian bulk sausage that was ok, tasty but not overly salted and then bought same brand and could barely eat it! We are on sodium restricted diets and try to be very careful!
I make this often. My husband and I love it. We‚Äôre having this for dinner tonight, in fact, on this stormy Maine day.
My wife doesn‚Äôt like the seeds in the Italian sausage so I subbed out for Tennessee pride and I like it more
I love this recipe as it is. I use red potatoes and kale in mine, and put just a little more crushed red pepper! So good!
I used Kale with Better than Bullion Chicken for broth. Used plain sausage and add a big Tablespoon of Italian Seasoning. Put some sliced parsnips in. love this soup and make it often in the winter!

I thought it was amazing! I'm a lacto/ovo vegetarian, so I obviously altered it. I used faux Italian sausage and bacon, half vegetable broth/half vegetarian chicken "Better than Bullion," and substituted undiluted evaporated milk for the cream. All the flavorings were right on. Probably would have been out of this world for you meat-eaters!!
I just made this soup for the second time because it was so amazing the first time! I added some roasted broccoli the first time and this time sliced baby bella mushrooms as well. Simply divine!!

I've been looking at this recipe for a long time, so I finally got around to doing so. It was great! My two biggest critics my husband and my 16 year old grandson gave it a high five! The only slight change I made was to reduce the red pepper flakes to 1/2 tsp. Yummy!

Quite by accident I discovered a useful shortcut. Instead of kale I used baby spinach. At Thanksgiving I had an extra box of fresh baby spinach that would have gone bad before I used it. So I froze it. When adding to this soup, the frozen pieces were fragile and I quickly crushed it as I added it. No need for a knife.

The recipe is perfect, however i did use Kale. I used to order this soup at a well known restaurant. Now that I have made this, it is way better. This is my ENTIRE family's favorite dinner. Great job!
Love this soup and just made it last night but used Kale instead of spinach.
This was indeed "Super-Delicious Zuppa Toscana"! And it was very easy to make. I love this soup!
I was sooo disappointed. The soup came out with a flat taste. I used mild Italian sausage and spinach. And no salt chicken broth. Not sure what I did wrong.
Yep. Thanks for that. Mine was significantly hotter due to availability of mild italian sausage. Other than that easy to make, cheap ingredients (except for bacon?!), great results....
So good that I made it twice in one week. Used kale instead of spinach. Made it with and without bacon and we loved it both ways.

Delicious!! A new family fav! I used sweet Italian and hot Italian ground sausage, and I substituted cubed, frozen, butternut squash for the potatoes. Also used a spinach and kale mix. Will make again and again!!

To the reviewer who used ‚ÄúCampbells chicken broth‚Äù and said the recipe was ‚Äúextremely salty‚Äù‚Ä¶ Campbells is CONDENSED so if you don‚Äôt account for that, there‚Äôs your problem. This recipe doesn‚Äôt call for salt so it‚Äôs impossible for it to be too salty if you use the correct ingredients.

Great recipe, I used 2 cups of heavy cream and 2lbs of sausage and I doubled the red pepper. Also used 3 bundles of kale, very hearty soup this way. First time I ever made soup, and it turned out great.

I make this soup once each year during last Summer/Fall and each time it always taste amazing. FYI......using kale instead of spinach is really good also. Both are great and are amazing choices to use. However, kale contains more than twice the amount of vitamin C than spinach. Likewise, spinach provides more vitamin K, vitamin A, and folate than kale.
The preparation was a bit long but well worth. Never made this before and I will make it again and again. It was excellent. Well worth the prep time.
Super delish!!! Thanks for sharing!
This soup is as good or better than olive garden.
It truly is "Super-Delicious"!!! I added extra bacon and used Tuscan kale as my only change. My hubby and guest were both impressed!
I discovered this recipe several years ago here, made it, loved it then, and still do today. I use Kale instead of spinach and that was the only change I made.
I made this soup per directions for a family gathering and used sweet Italian venison sausage. It was a major hit. Everyone loved it. I will definitely make this again.
This was absolutely delicious. My Italian husband said it was the best soup I ever made....and I've made a LOT of soups!
Very good. I substituted the potatoes for cauliflower and skipped the bacon. We will make this again. We also added mushrooms and roasted corn.

My husband and kids loved it! I made the whole bacon package and saved some for garnishing. I only had half of the chicken stock that the recipe called for, to make up for it I added water and chicken bullion. I also did half spinach and half kale. Additionally I had mistakenly bought whipping cream instead of heavy cream, it all worked out.

Very good, would make again for sure. I used a bag of frozen kale in place of the spinach. I also used a mixture of 3 tablespoons room temp butter and 3 tablespoons flour to thicken it up at the end. Also added salt and pepper.

Wonderful as made above. I have made it many times and it is always good. I prefer the kale to spinach because the later one gets too mushy and kale does not taste at all like kale, but quite good. I try to use some vitamin packed veggies sometimes and this is the only recipe I have found to love the kale. Don't forget to serve with toasty crusty French bread. Yummmm

I have made this recipe several times and added a little bit more salt. It is always a big hit when I serve it with Crusty French bread. I have even added chicken to it that I may have had deboned and had leftover in the refrigerator from the day or two before. It just makes it meatier with the chicken and the sausage and bacon.
No changes made
Loved this - would add more salt though.

Love this recipe. Can't tell you how many times I've made it. I made it exactly the first time but we like meat and heat here so modifications I have made since are: added a whole pound of bacon, added HOT Italian sausage links for another 1/4 of sausage and some heat, added more red pepper flakes (1 tablespoon), potato sizes vary so does how many I add. When I finish it is very hearty and is requested once or twice a month through the cold season. Thanks for sharing souporsweets.

Delicious! I haven‚Äôt had the restaurant one but I am definitely a fan of this soup! Husband liked it too! Very hearty. I halved the recipe and it came out beautifully, sometimes things don‚Äôt translate. This did:)
Great recipe. Out of the soups I usually make this was declared the favourite! I substituted evaporated milk for whipping cream . Add close to the end and do not boil to prevent it from separating.
Everyone loved it and had seconds.
I make this all the time, it is my son's favorite soup and it's always perfect.
This soup is perfection. Everyone at my house gobbles it up and asks for more!
I added 0.5 tsp Thyme, .25 tsp Rosemary, 1tbsp chunk fresh ginger, and used kale instead of spinach. I saut√©ed the kale in bacon fat. Added Mozzarella cheese since I didn't have Parmegiano Reggiano
This recipe is so good. Mine turned out a bit beige instead of white but it was delicious. I only changed out the spinach for kale because I don‚Äôt like spinach. My husband loved it too. Thank you!!

I keep Italian sausage in the deep freeze all the time, just in case I feel like making this soup. It is the easiest and yummiest thing. The only thing I change is that I use kale instead of spinach because it holds up better for left-overs and I just use a 32 oz carton of low-sodium chicken stock instead of 5 cans. If I don't have cream, I just use whole milk and add some butter. I used half and half last time and it was just great! Russet potatoes are going to give you the creamiest texture, but I've used yukon gold and other types. I definitely recommend draining the sausage and the bacon grease before saut√©ing the onions. This is the best!
Excellent! I used half and half: Still delicious. I would have liked more guidance on the spinach quantity: Just guesstimated it, and it could have used much more.

This is my family‚Äôs favorite soup at Olive Garden, so when I saw the recipe, I couldn‚Äôt wait to make it. I tweaked the recipe as well based on the reviews I read and it turned out so delicious and satisfying. Kudos for sharing this wonderful recipe. The changes I made are as follows: -used (2) cartons of chicken stock -used half and half -used (3) large Russet potatoes -omitted bacon -used 1/2 tsp tarragon spice -used kale
We added a touch of lemon juice. I just had lunch at a farm to table restaurant and that chef added a touch of fresh lemon to every dish. Fantastic addition
Excellent. I added a small box much of chopped fresh Basil on top.

I've made this a dozen or more times. Each time I go into Olive Garden I learn something else about the recipe. I've refined mine to where it is exactly like OG's. I like the spinach better (it's what OG uses) because it is softer and blends well with the texture of the soup. Love kale but it isn't for this soup. Unpeeled thin sliced red potatoes are perfect. This is not only one of the easiest soups to make it is delicious and everyone loves it. It's light enough to go as part of a meal or substantial enough to have alone with OG's bread sticks. Every thing on this recipe is spot on. Using milk or half and half will not change the flavor at all. If salty is the problem, use salt free ingredients and add your own to taste. Oh and keep the parmesan handy, it's a must to sprinkle in this soup.
speaking as a 15 yr employee of OG if you use chicken base instead of broth it will be richer. this is my husbands favorite soup and will eat it anytime of year!
Wonderful recipe!! My husband loves it!! So do I!!!

Used this recipe a few time before, but this time added a few little twists, used kale instead of spinach, and added saut√©ed mushrooms, and used golden potatoes, instead of red, or russet, much better flavor profile. Also allowed it to simmer for 23-30 minutes with all ingredients except for the potatoes and cream. Then let it simmer another 20+ minutes after potatoes and cream were added. Family loved it..
I was craving a something hot! This soup is savory and hit just right. I made exactly as noted, adding only a pinch of kosher salt and black pepper
I made it with spinach, and I made it with kale. I like the kale much better.
Absolutely outstanding! Used half & half instead of heavy cream - that was my only change. Have made this for a few people and they all think it's spectacular. Definitely a go-to recipe!
Other than a dash of Italian seasoning, I followed the recipe to a T and it came out absolutely delish! This will be added to regular rotation at the family table.
This was not my first time making it. My hubby love it and so do I. It is undoubtably one of my favorites.

I used kale and Swanson chicken broth and cubed the potatoes instead. I made the mistake by cooking the bacon in the same pot before all the ingredients. It was slightly too greasy but other than that, it was a great recipe! I love this soup! I made this in early February. It is one of my favorite soups!
This soup was very delicious and easy to make. My husband absolutely loved it. Thank you for this recipe.
Tastes every bit as good, perhaps better, as the one I order off the menu at Olive Garden. I used kale, as that is what I had. Will be my ‚Äúgo to recipe‚Äù for company from now on!
Made this tonight! Was excellent. Will add to rotation during cold months. I did use hot Italian sausage and added Romano to the broth at the end for extra flavor

made this exact. you can change it up by using different sausage. Spicy or sweet. Either ones come out delicious . I am addicted to this soup. Only change is I cube my potatoes instead of slices. It actually freezes well too.

Just as good as OG's if not better. I couldn't find bulk sausage, so I used regular Italian sausage which I split in half and then chopped into smaller pieces. I would highly recommend that you cut the recipe in half however since it makes a lot more than 6 servings. I think we got about 10 servings out of it. I no longer have to wait to go to Olive garden when I want this soup! Awesome!

I made this recipe today, -followed the recipe to a 'T', with the minor exchange of Swiss chard for the spinach. The change did not affect the flavor, and it turned out so much better than I expected! I've tried other Zuppa Tuscano soup recipes, but none compared to this one. It tastes just like the one you get from the restaurant. Saving this one - I will absolutely make this again.
Doubled the recipe and used 1 lb regular sausage and 1lb hot. Lightly used red pepper flakes because of this. Added more spinach as well. Delicious!

Good recipe I do not add any extra salt, use one 32 ounce Swanson chicken broth then fill up the container with water and add half of it to the pan. I use half pound of Italian sausage and use olive oil to saut√© the onions and garlic not the grease drippings from the Italian sausage. Then wait an hour before adding half and half not cream.
Closest recipe I've found so far
